illroute66 said
Server works if I login to Yahoo Mail as I'm able to do that. Issue with Thunderbird login. Any ideas?

sing web mail uses none of the yahoo IMAP or SMTP servers, so you are not compering apples with apples.

However if the delay is measured in minutes it may be a timeout is happening where the server is simply not responding, or you have software (antivirus usually) that is blocking the connection and seeing abnormal activity. Firs up a cold restart of your computer and any modems or routers is a good idea.

content: This seems to be a situation where setting up filters to check incoming mail and them move to desired folders. If you need more information, please respond with specifics. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Tools > Message Filters Click on 'New' Create a filter with a meaningful name which auto moves new mail and manually to the desired folder. Save the filter Enable the filter.

Then switch on the Filter Log. Click on 'Filter Log' button Select the checkbox 'Enable the filter Log' click on top right X to close Filter Log window.

Check filter works by selecting the filter and setting it to 'Run selected filters on' and choose the 'Inbox'. click on 'Run Now' Any emails in Inbox that match the filter criteria should get moved to desired sub-folder. Info can be found in Filter Log.


There is a Help Article on using Message Filters. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
There is no supported method to revert to a previous version. Going backwards almost always looses data as the profile file formats change on update and are not downgraded.

Let me guess, it also asked you to set up your mail account again when first run by asking you for your email address and password. So it has probably decided to use a new profile. https://thunderbirdtweaks.blogspot.com/2019/09/i-lost-my-profilemail-on-update-to.html

To be honest however I have no idea what you would be doing to add shortcuts to your desktop for email, and I fail to understand about the specific folder either, unless you previously had filters in your profile and the new one does not have them.

creator: 0rion79

content:
Thunderbird cannot move messages by changing folder location. So, unless you MOVED the messages, the messages are still available, my guess is they are where the default profile is. click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' in left column and click 'open folder'. you are now in the profile. Imap messages would be in the Imapmail folder and POP mail would be in the Mail folder and mail stored to Local Folders would be in Mail\Local Folders.

If you want an account on drive D, a simple way is to exit thunderbird, then COPY the account from the profile to drive D, restart thunderbird, and click the 'server settings' pane and change the 'Local Directory' pointer to point to the new location on D. Thunderbird will probably restart and it will use drive D. at this time, the account data in the mail profile may be deleted.

creator: h.brissenden

content:
It's likely that some other program is interfering hence why Thunderbird is not responding. The most common culprit is an Anti-Virus which maybe doing any of the following : scanning various files in the profile when they open or scanning any emails which may be attempting to get downloaded etc.

Do this: Access Anti-Virus product and make the Thunderbird profile folder exempt from scanning. Also temporarilly stop Anti-Virus from scanning any emails or files that get downloaded. Then start Thunderbird to see the effects.

The proper method of testing whether you have a program or Anti-Virus etc causing the issue is to do the following:

  • Exit all programs.
  • Restart Computer in 'Safe Mode with Networking' mode. If you use a wireless connection then you may need to use an ethernet cable to connect computer to router whilst testing.
  • Then start up Thunderbird.

You have to create a secure mail key and use that in TB instead of the account password used for webmail access:

Remove the entries for the account from Saved Passwords in Settings, restart TB, enter the secure key when asked for a password.

content:
Solved! Was watching a completely unrelated YouTube video and it made me think of a possible solution, which worked.

SOLUTION: Go into the settings page for TB, and enable "Accept Cookies From Sites" then set the drop-down connected to it to "Always."

content:
Hello there

To send us a crash report, you can press certain buttons on your typing board. This contains two folders to send to us if this is a possibility with your PC environment? Do you receive error messages on your screen continuously or worse could be the hardware problem. Please try to take a screenshot of your current status regarding notifications.

Press Windows Key+R on the keyboard. A Run dialog will open. In the Run dialog, type %APPDATA%\Thunderbird\Crash Reports\ and press Enter.

content: The list of open tabs at last closing is stored in the profile file session.json. It may have become corrupted, in which case you could rename or delete it, with TB closed. It's automatically recreated when TB restarts. Also possible you have an app like CCleaner or Privazer that periodically resets files like session.json. In normal cases, a TB update doesn't affect the file.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thank you for this, sfhowes--I am not a techhie person, so can you guide me a bit?

Q: Should I rename it? If so, what should I call it? Q: Or should I delete it? Which is best? Q: This has happened several time in the last few months, and it is heartbreaking to lose my tabs. Any way to avoid it? Q: CCleaner? how can I find it and disable it?
creator: eyeart

content: Here are the session.json files I have found (attached)--what should I do with them?
creator: eyeart

content:
Rename session.json to session.old or just delete it, while TB is closed. Restart TB a few times and see if the opened tab set is retained.

CCleaner is a 3rd-party app that should appear under All apps/programs if it's installed. If so, disable any effect it has on TB, or uninstall it if it's not needed for other purposes.

content:
This is a Support Forum and not some form of one on one email, chat or ticket system.

From https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/

Can I request a refund? Your donation may be eligible for a refund. You must contact us within 15 days after the date of the donation. If you believe this donation was made without your authorization, please contact us immediately. Donations made via ACH or SEPA direct debit are ineligible for refunds. Due to the nature of these transactions our policy prioritizes minimizing refund fraud. We sincerely appreciate your understanding. If you have any further questions, please contact us.
